title.narrative: IMPROVED LEARNING OUTCOMES IN CHILD-FRIENDLY SCHOOLS AND ECD CENTRES

description.narrative: Teachers and school management in early childhood education centres, elementary and primary schools have improved skills to deliver child-friendly education and learning outcomes including for out-of-school children in rural and remote areas in selected provinces.

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of early learning / pre-primary education teacher training
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
Provision or procurement of accessible learning materials for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Teachers and school management in early childhood education centres, elementary and primary schools have improved skills to deliver child-friendly education and learning outcomes including for out-of-school children in rural and remote areas in selected provinces.

description.narrative: Education service delivery in PNG has been enhanced for 2,720 children (Girls: 1,422) including 56 children with disabilities (Girls: 29) bringing the cumulative number of children participating in early learning and non-formal bridging classes to 9,178 (Girls: 4,782) since the start of the 2018-2022 UNICEF PNG country programme. UNICEF partnered with faith-based and local civil society organizations in four provinces to further strengthening elementary and primary school boards of management functions through capacity development around implementation of School Learning Improvement Plans supporting 18,270 children (Girls: 8,770) with improved child-friendly teaching and learning environments. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Primary schools in selected provinces have well-functioning student learning assessment system for grade 2/3 and eight.
Number of schools that have incorporated disaster preparedness and response plans in School Learning Improvement Plans
Number of teachers trained on the National Quality School Standard Framework CFS
Service Delivery - Schools that received support from UNICEF through the child-friendly school or similar model
System Strengthening - Gender - National education sector plan/policies support gender-responsive teaching and learning - score (1-4), see guidance
Number of ECE teachers trained on ECE curriculum
Service Delivery - Out of school children in the reporting year who participated in early learning, primary or secondary education through UNICEF supported programmes
